website_summaries.verdict: Unlike many other styles, these cut-resistant gloves feature slip-resistant palms, so you won't lose your grip.
pros: Fiber blend technology makes gloves four times stronger than leather
Ideal for using cutting machine and glass handling work
For use with sharp blades rather than pointed objects
cons: May run small, so consider sizing up when ordering

customer_reviews.title: Only one pair, not worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Don't make the same mistake I did. This is only one pair of gloves, not 5 pair (I misread the Cut resistant level 5 work gloves as "Cut resistant level", "5 work gloves". Definitely not worth the price. They are basically non refundable because it cost six dollars to return the gloves unless you want to drive 20 miles through Seattle traffic to the nearest free drop off location. They are thin coasted rubber coated cotton gloves and not worth $15 a pair.
customer_reviews.author: HappyLearner

customer_reviews.title: Very tight
customer_reviews.text: The fabric is very thin and flexible. The palm material is thicker and stiffer as expected but very "grippy". I have small hands and ordered medium. The medium is very tight on me so I am concerned they may limit how long I can wear them because of restricted circulation. I haven't stabbed or sliced myself to test them. Hopefully will work well.
customer_reviews.author: Hoot

customer_reviews.title: Ordered a second pair
customer_reviews.text: The grip on these is amazing. These are great for working with power tools because they protect you while not reducing your level of control and precision which increases safety and you don't have to take them on and off constantly so you work faster too
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Holds up to slices from sharp knives using moderate pressure
customer_reviews.text: I just received my gloves today, and immediately put them to the test. They hold up very well when attempting to slice them with a sharp knife using moderate pressure, but when applying a good amount of pressure, I did cut through the glove. See the image I uploaded. I gave it 4 stars because for the money, you get a good amount of protection. These gloves fit a little bit small. I purchased size XL, but they feel more like L. The coating on the palms give you more grip, but take away dexterity. I would prefer the coating be only on the fingertips and the fleshy part of the palm.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gloves are probably sized for women only
customer_reviews.text: I bought a medium sized pair and they are way too tight. All other medium sized gloves I buy from regular hardware stores fit me fine. I can only assume that these gloves are for women only.
customer_reviews.author: P. Lau

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality..
customer_reviews.text: Boyfriend used them for a day and a half and the material started breaking off (first two pictures). After one week of use, the gloves were almost completely torn apart. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: CNJ

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves but sizing is weird
customer_reviews.text: They seem like nice gloves that would work well, but the sizing is all over the place. I normally wear a medium, so that's what I ordered first, but they were way too small. Then I ordered a large, and those were way too big.
customer_reviews.author: Geekspice

customer_reviews.title: These things are amazing. Far exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: These things are amazing. Far exceeded my expectations. I used them to clean the gutters and no cuts on my hands from the overhanging shingles. They were form fitted perfectly so I could do all the work without taking them off. Of course water got to my hands but that is to be expected. Next time I am going to try rubber gloves underneath to see how that works. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Twelve Young Sons

customer_reviews.title: Wish the glove tactical feel was better
customer_reviews.text: Gloves don’t hold up well in working conditions. The rubber tips deteriorate too quickly and catch on everything. The gloves may provide cut resistance but other than that they aren’t that great.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT TAYLOR

customer_reviews.title: Like the Kevlar palm, but was too small for me.
customer_reviews.text: I like the Kevlar palm that this model has. I also bought two other models, one with and one without a Kevlar palm. The one without gave me the impression that it might come unraveled overtime. Unfortunately, even the largest XL size of this model was too small for my very large hands. So I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Earthwatcher

customer_reviews.title: Rubber peels off quickly
customer_reviews.text: They're ok but the rubber peels off quickly with daily use, which rids them of their protective quality and makes them ineffective. This is even worse if they get wet. I used them one day at work with wood that was damp from a recent rainfall and after that they were pretty much garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I use these to fillet my freshly caught bass and pickerel. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Jagacki

customer_reviews.title: Worry free meat slicing
customer_reviews.text: I used these successfully for slicing abalone fresh from the ocean. Abalone are extremely slippery and I had always worried about cutting myself but with these gloves there was no problem. Should have got them years ago and can now do very precise slices.
customer_reviews.author: Buck Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Good fish cutting gloves!
customer_reviews.text: Had the old model and this one is much better. Use it twice a week and holding up great!
customer_reviews.author: lokelani 2

customer_reviews.title: Excellent gloves modest price.
customer_reviews.text: great and modest priced safety gear for working with broken glass or cutting fish - which we do a lot of. And quite comfortable as a work glove - good and grippy for slippery items.
customer_reviews.author: Marjorie W. Dunaway

customer_reviews.title: X-Large is more like Medium-Large
customer_reviews.text: My normal glove size is MEDIUM, and these X-larges are actually quite snug, so they are at least Large, if not a Medium-Large. The construction is good, just the sizing is a little bit off.
customer_reviews.author: aTypicalEngineer808

customer_reviews.title: Great experience with this seller.
customer_reviews.text: Construction and fit is great, I hope I never get to test the cut protection with these but the reviews sound very positive as to cut resistance. I also have the heat resistant BBQ gloves and they are great. I will always check with you if I need any gloves in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie peterson

customer_reviews.title: No grip and small
customer_reviews.text: These gloves run about a size small I ordered XL and they fit more like a L-M, then the coating on the glove renders it useless if you pick up anything damp or smooth! Definitely would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Fit great, extremely durable Cons: hot, hard to put on and take off, kinda like super durable hand condoms. Great if you put em on and leave em on, bad if you like to take em on and off alot
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the greatest thing ever invented
customer_reviews.text: This is the greatest thing ever invented. After slicing off part of my finger with a mandolin slicer I was afraid to deal with anything sharp. After much research I decided to give these a try. They're definitely strong enough to keep my fingers safe from my clumsiness.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: ehhh... kind of works a little
customer_reviews.text: I had much higher expectations for these gloves. I have razor sharp knives and while they help a little with an accidental light slash, a poke from the heel of the blade goes right through. Also, after any slashing the fibers are noticeably damaged and longevity reduced. I'm going to stick with stainless mesh.
customer_reviews.author: fixxxer

customer_reviews.title: Husband says these are A1
customer_reviews.text: After 6 months my husband said the gripping wore off but he still uses them. For other things.
customer_reviews.author: Jewel

customer_reviews.title: but I like them to be tight so I can do things ...
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used these much. A little tight and I don't have large hands, but I like them to be tight so I can do things with my hands like pick up smaller things etc, so these are fantastic for me.
customer_reviews.author: D and L Co

customer_reviews.title: Order up one size
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these once before in a medium. The other reviews are correct, order a size up over what you usually order. I got the large this time and it fits much better.
customer_reviews.author: luvboating

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last
customer_reviews.text: Used the gloves for less than week and the rubber coating came off in several places. These gloves gripped my fingers better than any glove I’ve ever worn and we’re almost like a finger trap when taking them off. If these gloves lasted they would be the prefect glove
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Cut Gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are OK. I bought XL and the fingers were too short, the thumbs too long. I prefer Dewalt cut gloves from Home Depot. Great fit, rugged, comfortable, and flexible.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Gill

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: well... the first thing I did after getting this was to call my friend over, open the door, and immediately start trying to cut my own hand with my kitchen knife My hand is fine, 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Fuzzhao

customer_reviews.title: Great for those using saws and knives!
customer_reviews.text: Saved a finger or two already. Just get the right size.
customer_reviews.author: Cognizant Consumer

customer_reviews.title: They work! Saved my instrument playing fingers!
customer_reviews.text: I got these to use with my Benriner Mandolin slicer and they've saved my flute playing fingers a few times. They didn't even get cut by the fresh sharp blade. When the rubber hits you can feel it and stop moving. It jams in there. They're great for handling slippery produce as well. I found that I could eve use the rough texture to easily rub carrots clean and remove those thin annoying layers of the onion.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan h kypros

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good but not great...
customer_reviews.text: I thought the gloves were a cool concept. I wore them all of about 30 minuets at work and the rubber just started wearing all the way off... I Like the protection and the fact you can use your fingers and feel while working but the rubber part is not that great... By the way I still have the gloves I wear them under a bigger pair of rubber palms that are not cut resistant.
customer_reviews.author: MitchellHowton

customer_reviews.title: ... shucking oysters and I am able to get a good grip on the shells
customer_reviews.text: I use these for shucking oysters and I am able to get a good grip on the shells.
customer_reviews.author: CAD&AZD

customer_reviews.title: 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻
customer_reviews.text: Is great but it makes my hands sweaty and make them smell like plastic
customer_reviews.author: Marc Herr

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I work with very sharp equipment at work and most of the time, the calf leather gloves would be slit the moment we touch the cutter blades of the machine. However, the G&F have stood up to the task. Even the latex coat is tough. Highly recommended for those who cherish the best tool in the world - our hands.
customer_reviews.author: James Moy

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal
customer_reviews.text: These are holding up pretty well for diving. As well as most leather glove at 1/2 the price.
customer_reviews.author: Don Naber

customer_reviews.title: Does the job protecting the hands
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and flexible, protection is excellent. Use these around the house and especially when cleaning out the gutters - have a metal roof and the edges of the roof are extremely sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Wes Martin

customer_reviews.title: Move glass without fear
customer_reviews.text: As a glass artist I know most cuts happen when you're moving glass not actually working/designing with it. These are helping me keep my hide intact.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce U.

customer_reviews.title: Great for basic kitchen use
customer_reviews.text: These are flexible enough and seem strong. I mostly use them when I do a lot of peeling. I've saved my fingers many a time. They stay clean compared to most fabric-only gloves.
customer_reviews.author: E. C. Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Lookout Oysters!
customer_reviews.text: I bought three pairs of these gloves to be used for oyster shucking. They have not yet been used, but the recipients think they will be perfect for the task. The quality and price both seem very good.
customer_reviews.author: nan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very useful if you are not adept with a carpet knife!
customer_reviews.author: C. M. Stine

customer_reviews.title: saved my hubbies finger from being sawed off
customer_reviews.text: great gloves, he orders them to keep on hand since he is a frequent user of a fleshing machine, a dangerous table saw like piece of equipment. Very well made.
customer_reviews.author: EE

customer_reviews.title: Everything gloves!
customer_reviews.text: Well I just gotta say, these gloves are amazing! I use them for field herping and the reptiles cannot bite through at all. I am not saying I handle deadly snakes with them or poisonous lizards but the other non venomous do not leave their teeth marks in me anymore. ha ha I love the light weight of these and they fit...well like a glove. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Captain Mac

customer_reviews.title: Nice Glooves.
customer_reviews.text: Good material and perfect fit. Saved my hand woodcarving a couple of times.
customer_reviews.author: Blayne Cannon

customer_reviews.title: He loved it! The fit was great/comfortable and he wouldn't ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband. He loved it! The fit was great/comfortable and he wouldn't shuck another oyster without it!
customer_reviews.author: Carin Grace Berchtold

customer_reviews.title: Great protection
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves, a little tight for XLG wish they had XXLG
customer_reviews.author: Garry Deal

customer_reviews.title: Bought them to use for pulling out blackberry bushes, ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought them to use for pulling out blackberry bushes, didn't work against the thorns on the bushes. They are heavier and hotter than regular gloves which would have been ok if they had worked against the thorns.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only large enough for children. Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Unwearable by a normal XL adult hand. They may be XL on a child, but will cut off circulation in an adult.
customer_reviews.author: hisierra4

customer_reviews.title: Kevlar gloves
customer_reviews.text: Used them for the first time last night at a bbq and they worked perfectly as expected. Great hand(s) protection.
customer_reviews.author: ERIC MILLER

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable fit and good grip.
customer_reviews.text: Good fit and very flexible. Used them on shaping sheet metal.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Civiok

customer_reviews.title: Very good glove
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are great. The fit well and comfortable. You are able to move and work with small parts and able work as if you don't have gloves on. They are very cut resistant as well.
customer_reviews.author: ktn

customer_reviews.title: Good Gloves for Home Inspectors
customer_reviews.text: The picture makes the gloves look bigger than what they actually are, but they are a nice item. Snug fit (but not too tight), and the rubber coating gives the gloves good gripping ability. Crawling around under a house, or up in an attic, it is easy to stab something into your hand accidentally. These glove provide the needed protection without being too bulky.
customer_reviews.author: KEVIN K. JACKSON

customer_reviews.title: Rubber wears very fast
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, good grip for carving however the rubber wire off very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: G Harper

customer_reviews.title: I bought these as a Christmas present for my husband ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a Christmas present for my husband and he absolutely loves them! He cuts cabbage and says that these gloves prevents cuts and wet hands!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: After only one day at work the rubber peeled off the fabric
customer_reviews.author: camel josh

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my honey to use when cleaning up construction job sites. He uses them not only for that but also for processing meat in his meat market. Loves them
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Latex is coming off after only 2 weeks of use
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Decent gloves but I prefer leather
customer_reviews.text: It says they're more cut resistant than leather and maybe they are, I haven't tried to cut them, but they're not as good against punctures for sure. My parakeet bit right through it. Next time I'm buying leather.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald S. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: I like these gloves a lot
customer_reviews.text: I like these gloves a lot. They just tore a little while I was grinding glass, but I expect that of any glove.
customer_reviews.author: Nikkib

customer_reviews.title: Not cut resistant
customer_reviews.text: As the title says, these gloves are certainly not cut resistant. While butchering some wild hogs, I cut through the glove and into my thumb with very little effort at all. I do keep my knives very sharp with a steel by sharpening them often. After the bleeding started to subside, I decided to take some pictures as proof.
customer_reviews.author: Livin'nTn

customer_reviews.title: Not the greatest gloves
customer_reviews.text: Using these gloves for daily use with scissors. After 1 week, the material started deteriorating. Not a huge expense but I wish the gloves lasted longer.
customer_reviews.author: luvtoshopamazon

customer_reviews.title: Here fishy fishy...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves and they work great for diving, i like the heavy duty plastic in the palm however it just wasn't thick enough for some fish dorsal fins.. still got stabbed in the palm of my hand.... would have given 5 stars if it was double the thickness...
customer_reviews.author: Kristofer Kepler

customer_reviews.title: Definitely NOT puncture resistant
customer_reviews.text: I ONLY reason that I bought these gloves is that these were SUPPOSED to be puncture resistant. These are very far from being puncture or cut resistant. These gloves cannot even block from small wooden or plastic pointed objects, how in the world would they stand up against glass and even more solid objects. These gloves are total GARBAGE. STAY AWAY FROM THIS USELESS PRODUCT!! Save your money and buy some better quality gloves from a hardware store.
customer_reviews.author: kevinliuser

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but
customer_reviews.text: Not as durable nitrile coating as magid k-roc gloves and fit is in smallish side. However, main material feels like more durable, probably because are thicker than competitors.
customer_reviews.author: Just Me

customer_reviews.title: Great quality.
customer_reviews.text: These gloves have help up well. Look and feel good. Have great grip. They stretch and conform to your hand.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Carrero

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: It's got this texture that might help avoid a cut but it's basically just rubber. Save your money. You'd be better off getting a metal glove. A little cumbersome but works much better. The fit wasn't very good either. It felt tight on my palm but it was loose in the fingers. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So where's the Kevlar
customer_reviews.text: These gloves were listed among the search items for Kevlar gloves. I purchased the item, thinking I was buying Kevlar gloves.. But when they arrived, no reference to Kevlar on the packaging or the gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product :)
customer_reviews.text: Ive been taking it for a few weeks and it really gives me energy to get through the day and workout.
customer_reviews.author: Hma1218

product_meta.title: G & F 22600 XL Cut Resistant With Anti-Slip Silicone Blocks, Protective Gloves Scrapes, in Kitchen, Wood Carving Carpentry Food Grade 1 Pair, X-Large
product_meta.description:
Size:X-LargeG & F CUTShield Slash Resistant Series is using the latest exclusive HPPE cut resistant fiber blend technology. CE approves cut/slash resistant level 5. Machine Washable, but do not iron. Size: M-XL

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
G & F CUTShield Slash Resistant Series is using the latest exclusive HPPE cut resistant fiber blend technology. CE approves cut/slash resistant level 5. Machine Washable, but do not iron. Size: M-XL
feature_bullets: Cut protection Level 5 approved by EN388/CE
Exclusive HPPE cut resistant fiber blend technology
Ideal for using cutting machine and glass handling work
Sold by pair, washable, drip dry

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars144 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
